page.title: 04Filton Train Services
page.content: Some children wrote a letter to the area manager of Temple Meads Station to find information on train services. The reply gave us this information: Bristol Parkway station was built in 1972.The idea was to build a station outside the centre of Bristol which was near the Motorway and main roads so it would be easy for people to drive to.Because Parkway is out in the country there is a lot of room to park Atleast 1000 people use the station each day and some 75 trains stop there on their way to London,Wales,the South, the North and Scotland. North Filton Platform is only used by one train each morning and evening for people working at factories nearby.Filton Junction has 9 trains a day and is used by a few dozen people. There is no station at Filton West Junction.
